title: (x) Joseph and The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat - ITC Serif Gothic (warped) {Marc O}
content:
I am looking for font in Joseph and Technicolor Dreamcoat. I'm not sure if this is just freehand or an available font.   
Please assist
author: cebu4u

comments.content:
Welcome Rhonda.   
   
Can we have an image, a link, or something to look at ?

Rhonda, in order for us to help it would be best if you showed us an image of the type you want us to identify. That musical has been out a long time and there have been several designs used for the lettering for the show. Which one do you want ID'ed?

Sorry - I realized this a bit late and then couldn't add an attachment when I edited my post.   
Here it is...   
Thanks again! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050816133642im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47995.jpg)

I think it's pretty obviously hand-lettered -- no two instances of the same letter (E, A, C and R, for example) are the same.   
   
That said, the '70s vibe and tiny serifs remind me of ITC Serif Gothic.   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-serif-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050816133642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-serif-gothic/)
